title: What's cooking? [Episode 3/7]
creator_contributor_role: George Patterson Creative Group, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Cookery, Australian
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Electric apparatus and appliances - Safety measures
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Advertising - Australia - History
abstract: A television cooking show from the 1960s sponsored by the State Electricity Commission of Victoria, shows us how to make Chinese meatballs in chicken noodle soup.
description: The State Electricity Commission of Victoria (SEC) was not only a supplier of electricity, but was also a retailer of electrical goods, mainly electric Stoves. To show off the versatility of the stoves the SEC sold, they had a Home Economics department where cooks would come up with a variety of dishes and test them with via demonstrations at shopping centres, shows and fairs. In the1950s and 60s the popularity of television gave the Electricity Commission a much bigger audience reach -- the Cooking show was the perfect platform to sell Electric stoves.
